A

    A/B Testing

    A/B Testing

    A method of comparing two versions of something (like a website or email) by showing each to different groups of people to see which one works better.

    Above the Fold

    Above the Fold

    The part of a webpage you see first without scrolling, where important content and buttons are placed to grab visitors' attention immediately.

    Acceptance Criteria

    Acceptance Criteria

    Specific conditions that a software feature must meet to be considered complete and acceptable by stakeholders.

    A security system that determines who can access, view, or modify resources like data and applications by verifying identity and enforcing permission rules.

    A security system that controls who can access what files and resources on a computer or network by granting specific permissions to users and groups.

    Adversarial Attack

    Adversarial Attack

    Adversarial Robustness

    Adversarial Robustness

    An AI model's ability to work correctly even when given deliberately manipulated or tricky inputs designed to fool it.
